intro: Schizanthus calycosus, commonly known as the California common beggar's-tick, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a dry, dehiscent capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Schizanthus calycosus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
